question_text: A 66-year-old man is hospitalized for progressive dyspnea and recent onset of hemoptysis. He also has evidence of acute kidney injury.A chest radiograph is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA) (Option B), which is the most common ANCA-associated vasculitis. GPA affects the upper and lower airways, kidneys, eyes, and ears. Pulmonary manifestations of GPA include nodules, patchy or diffuse opacities, and hilar adenopathy. This patient's radiograph, shown below, demonstrates multiple pulmonary nodules (black arrows) and fluffy infiltrates (white arrows) that are compatible with the diagnosis of GPA. Because of the substantial risks associated with treatment, biopsy of involved tissue usually is recommended to confirm the diagnosis, and this patient should undergo kidney or lung biopsy.
